caption: ** Their COVID protocols include a temperature scanner near the entrance.  They mounted the thermometer on the wall at a certain height so shorter people might need to tippy toe for the forehead reading. Every employee is wearing masks and tables are placed to promote social distance inside.  There is a structure outside with seating for anyone who likes a cool a breeze with their food. Customers are required to fill out a contact sheet per health guidelines.  The menu is accessed via a QR code to limit physical contact.  My guest and I got a table in the corner which was nice.  Our main server was a very nice lady named Suchasinee (Sucha for short).  She checked on us often and made some good entree recommendations. Another employee named Jade came by to make sure we were good even though he may have been busy in the kitchen.  The drink menu was separate and consisted of signature cocktails and some beer options.  Each cocktail had a special combination that made it unique.  It is not very often that I would participate but some of the drinks sounded very good.  Sucha made some recommendations and we decided on Jungle Juice (Mehkong Compari, Cherry Heering, Grapefruit, Passionfruit and Hibiscus Lime) for myself and my guest ordered After A Long Day (Angels Envy, Chrysanthemum, Yellow Chartreuse, St Germain and Dolin) because the name stood out.  The Jungle Juice was very tasty and refreshing.  The After A Long Day is very strong and is a great drink for HH or winding down literally after a long day.  Compliments to the employee Pat who was at the bar as she made all the drinks for us.  And of course we had to have classic Thai Ice tea on the side.  Something newer about the menu was the addition of "KUB KLAEM" which they translate on the menu as "small plates" and are perfect for sharing and pairing with drinks.  The ones we tried were Goi Neu (Chef's signature dish consisting of Isan style spicy beef tartare, with shallots, toasted rice, cilantro and complemented by taro chips and seasonal vegetables).  A FAIR WARNING...this dish is VERY SPICY.  Even my guest who loves spcicy food had to take a step back after sampling the beef tartare.  I am not a big spice fan and thought she was exaggerating (which she was not).  This dish has a kick that will have flames of savory goodness dancing on your tongue while burning your taste buds.  I highly recommend it!!  The second dish we tried was the Koor Moo Yang (succulent grilled pork jowl with spicy jaew tamarind dipping sauce.  The pork was tender and savory yet I had no issue with the sauce (probably because my taste buds were damaged from the beef tartare. kidding) and we both were fighting for the last piece.  I lost that fight btw.  The third "small plate" we tried was called Pla Muk Yang (grilled octopus with cilantro and chili lime sauce). This is considered a favorite after school snack according to the menu.  These snacks are definitely fancier than what I am used to eating!  The octopus was tender and tasty.  For classic appetizers, we ordered the Chicken Satay with a side of peanut dipping sauce.  You cannot go wrong with that.  We wanted to try some entrees and I went with my go to Pad See Ew with Shrimp, Chicken and Beef (I paid extra for the latter as the dish usually only comes with one protein).  My guest has fancy taste and when our server Sucha mentioned Khao Pad Poo (crab meat fried rice with onions, scallion egg) it was ordered on the spot. It was nice to have a rice dish among everything else and this was a very good choice to share.  Sucha recommended one more dish was was a specialty called Pad Cha Talay (stir fry shrimp, squip, scallop mixed with birds eye chili, garlic, green peppercorn, lime leaf, basil and fingeroot) and this certainly lives up to its description. It sounds daunting but the flavors all complement each other.  Check this place out!!

It’s our favorite restaurant in the area! Such a fantastic spot- the service is wonderful, the food is spectacular, and overall it’s pretty reasonably priced. What more can you ask for? The best way to eat there is to share lots of small plates, everything is so delicious that it’s a fun way to try lots of different flavors. Give it a try, you definitely won’t regret it!
This place is awesome they accommodated all my needs and iam very needy. Thank you tong service people you're a class act
Great service and delicious food! The fried rice is so flavorful!

I ordered the salad while visiting with a friend. It was a huge plateful with really nice dressings. Getting the choice of pitta bread or oatcakes was a nice touch. I didn’t manage to finish it as it was filling with lots of chicken. My friend had one of the special dishes of the day and thought it was excellent. The staff as always were efficient and very friendly.
Food was amazing and delicious!
Great place. Highly recommend, amazing service and even better food!

I'm so glad there's such a wonderful place where I can spend a great time with my friends and family. When we went to your restaurant, it was very quiet. I'm going to continue visiting this restaurant because I like the relaxing environment, polite waiters, cheap prices, and great dishes. It was heavily recommended to everyone!
The Food was actually authentic. The prices were on a higher side. Still a thumbs up.

Amazing... higher end Thai food on par with places like Wayla. Flavors, presentation, authenticity are spot on. We had the oysters, banana blossom, pork, octopus, fish curry, and hoy jor, everything was unique and delicious. One of the best restaurants I’ve tried recently.
Absolutely lives up to the hype. Delicious food, drinks, and attentive staff. Absolutely recommend, just make sure to call ahead for a reservation for this popular hot spot!
Delicious food, the server always remembers my daughter and knows what is her favorite dessert so now this is her favorite restaurant...
The super restaurants in New York.The owner is very friendly.The staff was very helpful.Food was great.Highly recomend.

Authentic thai food that's bursting with flavor and REAL Thai spice! Everything here is incredibly delicious. Since discovering it a few months ago, my bf and I have been ordering from here on a weekly basis and it's been consistently good. We've never had a bad meal here. Highly highly recommend. Our fav is the pork jowl, naem khluk, green curry, and pad see ew. But really...everything is outstanding here.
So good , the service the food everything .
It was hard to get a reservation but well worth it! From the moment we stepped in, the hostesses were so welcoming. Oh and the food was delicious! Very impressed.

Was very excited to try this place after reading all the review. I ordered delivery from here. Pad Se Ew had absolutely no flavor what so ever. It’s normally a mild dish but this was so bland it tasted completely unseasoned. Major disappointment after the glowing reviews from other people. Also has the crab and pork wrapped in tofu skins. Also very bland and nothing special. Little flavor except a fishy smell from the crab. I missed typical Thai flavors, acid and heat. Maybe I ordered wrong but I won’t be ordering from here again: I’m sticking with Klom Klom on Wyckoff. Really sad I thought this sucked.

My friend showed me this place and it might be one of the best Thai food places I've been to before! It's so unique and the flavors are phenomenal. The staff are very attentive and great. We got the pork jowl, octopus, oysters, chicken satay, pad mhee ko rad, and crab fried rice. All delicious! Highly recommend checking this place out and they have great outdoor seating plus blankets and heaters.

Incredible. Must try if you love Thai food and are looking for some unique Thai eats. Wish I could have ordered everything on the menu! And nice outdoor heated and covered dinning. They’re a new comer to the NYC Thai scene, but are definitely more than worth the trip to Bushwick. Friendly and helpful staff are an added benefit, as well. :)
The spice is on point here! Everything's delicios.
I eat in this spot a lot since I work right next to it. I must say the customer service is always excellent and they keep the spot well kept all the time. Prices are fair and they serve big portions.
Great new addition to the neighborhood! Fair prices and great service!
Great service and great food!
Amazing food here. Oysters, the fried taro / roots , the signature noodles, everything masterful. Very happy that we this opened up, easily one of the best thai food I have had, if not the best.

Authentic delicious Thai food, modern but inviting atmosphere, and great service. Probably the best Thai restaurant in NYC right now. Great for friends, family, and small(er) gatherings, it's worth coming out to the area, even if you don't live in bed-stuy. Many dishes are meant to be shared so it's a fun experience. COVID: All employees were wearing PPE, (they even have a clear view into the kitchen to watch the chefs, who were all wearing PPE). They also had a lot of outdoor seating set up in like a semi permanent patio space, which was great and cozy, strung up with lights.  Pros: -Food. Really some of the best Thai food I've ever had, attested to by Thai locals who I've visited Tong with. Some of my favorites were Khao Soi (curry with noodles and chicken) and Som Tum Thai (papaya salad), in addition to any of the Kub Klaem (small plates), including the Goi Neu (tartare), Oysters (seriously good and fresh, dressed up Thai style), and Tod Hua Phee (savory and crisypy banana blossom pancake). -Atmosphere. A really inviting and modern space, even the plates and cutlery are really nice looking. Definitely a nice date spot. -Service. Incredibly nice people, I think many of the owners work the front of the house and their level of service and attention to detail really shows.  Cons: -None, really! I think they only con could be if you're looking to host like 10+ people (but who is during Covid?), the space could be tight. Still, once large gatherings are allowed I'm sure they would try to accommodate with a reservation or something.
Amazing food! Excellent staff that are incredibly friendly. Atmosphere is very inviting and comfortable. Great place for a group of friends and family! Our new favorite Thai spot!!
Love this new addition to Bushwick! Amazing food that doesn’t feel similar to other Thai restaurants in the area. Love that Tong is showcasing the other sides of Thailand. Get the jok and kuey!
Great food, a new staple in Bushwick. You have to try it!
Excuse my blurry pictures but I was just so excited to eat. It's the best Thai food hands down and I will be back next weekend for more!!!
Food was amazing and service was even better! Best Thai food I’ve had in New York

Holy moly...... Cooking is one of my gifts.... Yes I am a cook..... Definitely love the food .... Taste definitely show the professionalism.... Amazing recipes.....the quality supersedes the price!!!!!!

Seriously hard to choose my favorite dish! They specialize in small plates. They wanted to recreate the experience of going to Bangkok and eating on one of those streets with all the vendors.  We had a lot of dishes but these were the highlights for me: The oysters were crazy delicious with chili jam, lemongrass, mint, crispy shallots! Pork and crab stuffed bean curd skin with plum sauce. Fried chicken!!! Stunning shrimp cakes with cucumber relish. Raw sliced salmon with garlic, chili, and lemongrass. Isan beef tartare with taro chips and leafy veggies for wrapping. Green papaya salad with crunchy catfish and peanuts. Shrimp noodles with bean sprouts, chives, pickled radish.  You can get takeout or dine outside. The tables are well spaced and there's not a lot of foot traffic so it felt very safe.

We have ordered from Tong maybe about 5 times now and we have not been disappointed! We lived in Thailand for 2 years so we can be picky about Thai food but Tong really takes us back with the flavors. The best part is they use all the ingredients that they use back in Thailand which makes a huge difference. They even put the Thai eggplants in the green curry 🙌🏾! We are so grateful to have a place like Tong nearby.

Excellent food and super fast and friendly service! Love that the wine comes from Starr Wines right around the corner. Definitely coming back - so happy there's a great Thai place in the neighborhood!
Best new Thai in NYC!!
Food and service was amazing! We did mix of tapas at the recommendation of the server and they were delicious. They are BYOB at the moment, which is also pretty neat!

The food was excellent and the service was impeccable. Very extensive menu. Everything ordered was delicious. Service with a smile. I will definitely be back. The outdoor dining experience was handled well. Everything was constantly cleaned and made ready. The exterior was well lit, and the street is not a heavy traveled one. I highly recommend this place for a great meal and nice atmosphere.

Love love love this place. The food is incredibly tasty. I really enjoyed the food and vibes.  Chef Jade is the best. He made all the dishes tasted just like what I’ve been craving for. Oyster salad is a must!!!! After me and my friends tried this dish, we have to order more. Love the presentation as well as the taste:) yummmm!!  Catfish salad, salmon salad and grilled pork with spicy tamarind dipping sauce are so delicious!!!  Love the vibes and the service as well. Everyone is friendly and helpful.  I’d recommend this place. Will definitely bring more people and try more dish.

Incredible food! Chef Jade is the best and the entire team was incredibly friendly. Thai tapas is a new concept to me but the staff was great at giving recommendations and teaching us about Thai culture/cuisine.  The octopus was incredible. I can't believe how soft and tender it was. I also recommend the seafood curry in young coconut.  Lastly I have to say that I'm equally impressed with their Thai staple food. We wanted to get a basic dish and ordered the drunken noodle. It was honestly the best ever had in my life. You wouldn't think these dishes couldn't be "improved" but tong hit it out of the park!

Everything we had was delicious. Spice level was well balanced with the flavor of the dish - intense sometimes but never overpowering. The beef tartar was unique and tasty. Some classic Thai dishes to be found here but what really makes this place stand out is the exciting dishes I haven’t seen anywhere else. I look forward to coming back!

Not your typical Thai place. Offers a varied, interesting, and flavorful menu of small plates alongside more classic dishes. Food is incredibly fresh - the oysters, for example, were excellent. Highly recommend.

As a fresh gem in Bushwick, Tong offers a very authentic Thai experience with dieses from places across Thailand. Every dish is soaked with flavors, spices and fresh herbs Different from other Thai places I have been to, Tong has a smaller menu with highly selective items with distinct characteristics. No matter you like sweet, spicy, citrusy, gluten free, etc. you can always find a dish that will certainly satisfy your taste buds and stomach. Chic decor and friendly, quick service are plus. Can’t wait for indoor dinner to open!

The best authentic Thai restaurant in Brooklyn! Great music and nice vibes. Most importantly, excellent food. I ordered grilled pork jowl, crispy catfish, cucumber salad, and  crab meat curry with vermicelli noodles. All dishes were authentic to Thailand. Highly recommend this place if you’re looking for high-quality Thai food and friendly service. The servers were especially attentive and responsive. And check out the restroom which has Thai lottery tickets for wallpaper. As a native Thai person who has lived in NYC for 6 years, I definitely recommend this place!
Nice chilling place in the area.
I love this place, the food is delicious. Drinks are good. And  love that Singa beer from Thailand. The workers are very kind.
